title: Trekking to Snow View Point
review: We really enjoyed the trekking to the Snow View Point. We covered the distance in about 2 hours. Travelling on pony  is not that enjoyable as is travelling on feet.

title: just a glimpse of Himalayas.
review: One can get the glimpse of Himalayas from Snow view point and also if its snowing you can enjoy the beautiful view of Nainital.

title: Nothing great
review: If you have visited Kausani or Ranikhet on your trip, this place will not attract you but if you are only at Nainital then you will be able to see snow clad peaks

title: I will say excellent visit to view Snow View Point
review: When we visited Nainital, we went to view Snow View Point. It is a must visit a place. You will see the excellent view of Himalayas with full of Ice loaded Himalayas peaks. Excellent weather and a wonderful visit. A must go place.

title: Amazing view
review: From naini lake we took local vehicle. Its at high altitude. The place was chilled. The view of snow covered Himalaya was amazing. There are snacks center as well.

title: Good view of Himalayan peaks
review: This is the point where the cable car takes you to the top of the hill in Nainital.

title: Great photo opportunity and amazing view.
review: You can reach here by either ropeway/cable car or trekking or driving. Reach here on time or you will get waiting. The point has shops which have food and souvenir, a small game zone and at the top is a view point with binoculars. Here you can see the entire Himalayan Range if the weather is clear (which depends on your luck). The way to the view point goes adjacent to the gaming zone. Apart from the Himalayas, you can see few other points through binoculars. The charges for usage are minimal.

title: Snow view via Ropeway
review: One of the peculiarity you see on entering Nainital is the Ropeway which leads you to Snowview. Entry fee is adult -₹150 , Child  ₹100 (both ways for 1 hour stay). View of Nainital from rope way is breathtaking.

title: very high altitude place
review: ue to fog we could not see snow peaks which  cab be enjoyable when day is fog free.place can be reached through cable car/ropeway

title: Great View of Snow Peaks
review: Great view of the snow covered peaks from this spot. You can also grab a cup of coffee and Maggi while you enjoy the scenery.

title: Himalaya view.
review: Its just on the top of Nainital a very good place where you can see the Nainital bird eye view and also Himalaya view from this place. Do visit if you get time.

title: You can view if its not cloudy or over-sunny day
review: A great view of Chaukhamba peak. But you need luck also as written in the heading of this review. Good luck

title: Journey better than destination
review: It can be reached both by road and rope way.

title: View of himalay...
review: Best place at height  if you are lucky and weather in your favour than you can see the view of himalaya..

title: Come Here For the Views!
review: Located some 7 km from Nainital, this view point offers mesmerizing view of the lofty Himalayan Peaks like Nanda Devi, Trishul, etc. A place called Pangot is situated 9 km further from this place. The road leading there (Pangot) is narrow, ferocious and mind blowing at the same time. Eat some maggi at this view point and see several other points with the help of a telescope (₹20-30 per head). This place is also a perfect point to take some mesmerizing photographs for photography enthusiasts. Prefer a rental bike to reach this point. Rental bikes are available from ₹600-₹1000 (from Avenger to Thunderbird).

title: Mesmerizing Views of Mighty Himalayas
review: This point is very ideal to enjoy majestic views of Himalaya peaks, but need to mother nature on your side and pray she is in an obliging mood while you reach the view point.

title: Very beautiful place
review: The view from the point is really mesmerising. You can see the icy hills of nanda devi mountain and the Himalayan range.

title: Nice snow view
review: Snow view point on the peak in the Nainital is a nice view point to view the Nanda Devi and other Himalayan peaks

title: The view of the Himalayas is the only selling point
review: If you are lucky and the skies are clear, the view of the Himalayas are breathtakingly beautiful. Besides the view, there isn't much to do here. The childrens park is in terrible state and food options are limited.

title: Not worth visiting
review: After so much of travel, it is disappointing. It is better to spend time near Naini lake instead of visiting this place.

title: Awesome view
review: Great Mountaintop scenic spot with a ropeway... panoramic vistas of snow-capped Himalayan peaks... use binos it's available

title: Lovely view
review: Although it was raining and couldn't actually enjoy the majestic view of mountains but still the place was lovely. I am sure it will be beautiful during winters.

title: Mixed reaction
review: One reaches here after taking the ropeway ride. Though the place is beautuful, most of it is occupied with eateries, shops and amusement activities., so makes you feel there is nothing special. The view point is good and provides you with good view of valley and if weather permits you can spot himalayan peaks

title: Tourists point
review: Actually some five useless points they show with binoculars which are hardly beautiful. I wonder if any one has seen snow mountains from this point especially during summers. But people do-not mind trying it for 20rs. Wasteful exercise to pay for taxi and get fooled. What you see with naked eye is pleasure

title: spectacular view!!!
review: its a great tourist spot, you can reach here via ropeway or by car also, it a narrow road dotted with various eateries serving maggie, sandwich and the basic things, which are good...on climbing a few stairs this is a structure, on top of which you can witness amazing sunset view and the mountain range....

title: Amazing Scenic beauty
review: It's a good place to stay. Nice location, also has geat views at some points. I liked the food and their staff is also cooperative. I can consider it a good hang out place during summer vacations. Nice view and fresh pure air for the one who love mountains.

title: Very Nice View
review: Very Nice View. Went here in Dec'17. But no snow had started. But nice place to visit, if you go to nainital.

title: Touristy
review: Another tourist point with the Himalayan range view.  If the sky is clear, one can see the Himalayas.

title: Disappointing
review: This was one point I was really excited to visit. The whole ropeway experience was average. As it was cloudy,we couldn't see the Himalayas & the snow.There are eateries, game zones & toy shops at the point.Nothing great.

title: No snow view
review: I dont know about other seasons, but in october i bet that you can never see a snow mountain from there. All they show is some amitabachans movie spot and some other useless places. So plz dont expect to see a snow or else you will see a huge disappointment in front of you !

title: Not so good, not so bad
review: It is said that we can see himalayas from this point, but only during few months. The view from the height is good.

title: views only good in october
review: only on a highly clear day would one be able to see the himalayas. the road up is interesting, with views of naini lake

title: Only for visit in Oct-Jan
review: You can view the snow peaks only in period from Oct to Jan. For other months, it's too foggy. It's on the way to other points, so you may visit this one.

title: Not much to do except shopping and food
review: No views are available as most of the place has been occupied by traders and food joints.. too much commercialised.

title: Sad
review: No view at this time....I was very disappointed as I was thinking to have a gr8 view of himalayas but due to clouds nothing was visible.

title: A money making RV
review: Built on lines if Genting Highlands, Malaysia...The snow view point has almost zilch to offer especially in the peak season i.e. May/Jun as most of the times the peaks are covered with clouds. Can visit if want to take some rides, scales grossly under par viz-a-viz Gentings.

title: Nothing special
review: Can be avoided.. nothing special. You can save time and effort by skipping this. In summers all you get to see is the valley below and eat some Maggi from the local vendors.

title: Very Good Place for Kids and to View Himalayas
review: You can reach Snow View Point by Ropeway. Here Kids can enjoy Go cart, striking cars, rock climb and giant drop. Adults can enjoy the view of Himalayas with pictures of the amazing view of mother nature.

title: A view point at a height
review: This place might be beautiful in winters as views of Himalaya will be clear . Currently cloudy weather. Nothing visible

title: Beautiful View
review: This can be seen from the top when you go up the Ropeway. The snow- clad mountain in the distance looks really beautiful.

title: Nice view of himalyas
review: One gets to see snow covered himalyas from close. In winter season some lucky people may get to see ice on the top

title: Good place
review: Reaching this place is kinda difficult as Google Maps for some reason will take you the wrong way, but once you reach the top you can see some breathtaking views of the Himalayan range from here.

title: Hidden treasure of Nainital
review: This view point is great. Usually driver dont bring visitors here due to small roads usually single lane roads.. but everyone must go there. its very small place but the view from there is really great. The food you get there is Maggi and Waffles... they are great...

title: Scheme
review: You might be able to see distant snow capped peaks through a telescope if the skies are clear which only happens a couple of months a year!

title: Avoid in this season.
review: We hired local taxi for site seen. Disappointed on visiting this place as we were unable to see the snow from the place.

title: Only go in winter
review: The point is at right place but most of the time of a year not worth to go, as weather remain cloudy most of the time, might be possible to view snow mountains during october. We hired local taxi to see 7 points around nainital lake, this is one of them, but after reach got disappointed as nothing visible even not without snow.

title: Best point for panaromic view
review: This place is the best part of nainital for tbe panaromic view in nanital,picturesque  place one can have the view of natural beauty of god

title: Best with ropeway
review: This attraction is best enjoyable with ropeway. One can reach here by ropeway or by taxi from mall road. This point provides a view of other side of nainital. Best in winter to see snow laden peaks.

title: Spectacular views of Nainital
review: This point offers great view of the hills and the adjoining city of Nainital. Telescope is also offered here at a nominal price to view places far away. This place gets a little over crowded during the on season and hence you might find yourself in a small jam. However the traffic here is a moving one and hence you won't be standstill for long. A few food stalls are also available.

title: Snow capped view of nanda devi mountain from top
review: Take rental cab from mall road to reach here...complete tour of such spots at affordable prices

title: Disappointing experience
review: We went up the cable car which was thrilling due to its height. But at the top, there were regular stalls and a few plastic toy shops. Nothing great. The amusement park was ordinary n not yeT open at 9am. We went early as later it would become very hot.  The view of the lake was restricted, I so we walked up to the snow view point. Due to the summer heat n forest fires smog, nothing was visible. An attendant with the telescope was least bothered to even talk to us. Had he spoken to me I would have paid him more than the rs10/- fee for viewing points. He simply said whatever u want to know, is on the flex picture. That picture was absolutely washed away n nothing was visible.

title: Good Place
review: Good place to see Himalaya range, but the most important thing is weather if it is good then only you can see it.

title: Normal view point with no view of himalayas
review: We took a 7 point trip by car costing 700/-. Places covered -

title: Beautiful view of the Himalayan ranges
review: The point is not very crowded luckily. It gives a good view of the Himalayan ranges and the kumaun area. There was a young boy with telescope showing different points too.

title: Tawdry, not romantic and spoilt.
review: From Snow View one is supposed to be able to  see the mighty Himalayas.  One would have thought that at least the Government would have protected this spot from greedy and tawdry overdevelopment.  But no, they have allowed a broken down children's theme park and cheap and dirty restaurants and shacks selling cheap toys. It is hardly a romantic spot and not one I would want to taken to on my honeymoon!

title: Luck.. By chance
review: Don't go by the name except for months - December, January, (which is what i heard from the locals, Jan, Dec are the only months when you can find snow in nainital)

title: Sweet spot
review: Full of crowds honking their loud car horns. Go at odd hours to beat the crowds. Telescope viewing is of no use from april-sept. Rest of the time it's a sweet spot :)

title: Must visit place in ninital
review: It’s a must visit place in ninital . Very good view of valleys also a good place for photos .. wonderful climate ..

title: Himalaya View Point
review: This place is height from where you can witness a snow view and Himalaya if clouds are clear. Since, nothing much to do in Nainital this place is also famous among the tourists. There is a adventure park too where a group can enjoy.

title: You will love just love this.
review: The point offers a clear few of 5 peaks of Great Himalaya. Although the aierial distance to the Himalaya from Snow view Point is 125 km, but you can see magnitute of Himalaya covered with snow clearly. You will find many persons with telescope. You can view all 5 peaks @Rs 50 through telescope for greater clarity.

title: Mesmerizing view of Himalyas
review: I went here on new year's eve. Its such a nice place, it has lot of eatries, fun zone etc. The main point is where you can see the trishul mountains, you'll love it.

title: Great Place
review: Great view,you can see the entirety of himalyas from this point and the binoculars make it even better.An amazingly beautiful site to see the lake and the Himalayan peak at its best.

title: Finally I have seen the Himalaya from nainital
review: I came three time to Nainital prior to this visit but could never seen the Himalaya due to bad weather or fog. So best time to see the Himalaya is Oct-Nov as per my experience. One of the most awaited event and place of my life. Had a good experience

title: Amazing view
review: Awesome view of Trishul and Nanda Devi peak. They have got a binoculars installed up on the top, ticket cost 10INR for a minute gives you the spectacular view of the Himalayas. Another viewpoint is Naini lake. Rest there is nothing on the top except some food joints and games for kids. You can reach on top either by the cable car or on foot(trek). However with cable car, you get only an hour to stay on top.

title: a panoramic view!
review: snow view point is situated 3km away from main nainital town. went to snow view point very early morning to see the peak of himalaya as its the best part of this place. it was just awesome view of trishul and nanda devi peak.

title: View of the Himalayas :)
review: You will be seeing the most magnificent of the Himalayas from this place. The mountain ranges are beautifully covered with snow and you can also view it from a telescope that is available there at the cost of 30 INR. Another view at Nainital which can't be ignored.

title: Dirty place, loved the ropeway
review: The ropeway experience was awesome. The view of the lake from top was the best of all. But the view point needs maintenance. It was very dirty and full of nasty red spits. Food was average.

title: Can be better
review: One of the best place to visit if you are traveling to nainitaal.

title: Not the time to visit Snow view point in February
review: Took a ropeway to snaow view point. wanted to see Himalayan RAnge and NAini Peak point. However it was very cloudy and we could not see either of the point.

title: Great to see the real Hymalayas from here
review: Snow view looks out north westerly from the top of the hill overlooking Nainital Lake. To see snow-covered peaks hudreds of kilometers away was quite a sight.

title: Snow view- I liked to visit here
review: Visited snow view point and liked it very much. The view was excellent and liked it. I would like to visit here again.

title: Great view of Himalayas
review: The place provides lovely view of Himalayas. The view isn't guaranteed since sometimes fog covers the mountains but if you can get the view, it will be an awesome one.

title: Snow view
review: If you want to see snow at the top of hill you may go here. A hill you can see here this name is trishul parbat, which is nepal.

title: Good place to spend quality time with family
review: We have visited this place on our Nainital  trip.  The place is just near Naina Devi mandar.  You have to take rosewater ride to reach this place.  Good place to spend quality time with your family as this point having having activities for every age group...  Must visit places in Nainital..

title: View point of Himalaya
review: This is the best attractive point of Nainital and from here you have seen entire Himalayan range.The scenic beauty of this place is superb and unmatchable.By Telescope if you are lucky if no weather hazards to be there you can see Himalayan peak like Nandadevi,trishul etc.

title: Go for the view !!
review: We landed up here as a part of 7 point car tour of Nainital ! This is the best of the points from where on a clear day you have a view of the entire Himalayas with a view of Nanda Devi peak among others ! Carry a good camera(SLR) with a zoom to get a beautiful pic ! Check out the telescopes available at ₹10-30/- for seeing the various peaks. Small eats like Maggie, Pakoras, Paranthas, etc along with Tea/coffee are available at the various food kiosks. Enjoy the view.

title: Himalayas View
review: Snow View Point:

title: Superb
review: We took the cable car ride up - took us about 1 hour 45 mins - mainly due to the rush at the cable car ; from the cable car station take left and in a few metres on the right there is a cemented uphill trail to the hill top; at the top one can see many peaks - Nanda Devi, Trishul etc ; there is a guy with a telescope which one can use for better view. It was a lovely experience. Kids can enjoy the games while waiting for the cable car return time.

title: Beautiful view!!!
review: The snow view point was superb and excellent place to visit.  Such a beautiful place we visited last month.

title: Short vacation
review: Snow view May may be there in winters or some other season but in rainy season no snow view. There are only food shops are there. If you are having time you can visit.

title: Kids will enjoy
review: 3 minute ride to snow view mountain. Lots of tourists in summertime. Beter in off season period. Take a walk from snow vieuw to the next hill. Talk a walk down the hill instead of the cablecar. For children its fun cause there are games for them

title: Views
review: This place has a gorgeous view. If you happen to go here on a clear day then you will be lucky indeed. It's quiet, calm and Serene. You will also find a few people selling Maggi, chana chaat etc.

title: Good place pay a visit
review: go only if the weather is clear. else no point in going as the snow-capped will be not be visible. ofcourse, you can have a view of naini lake from the top.

title: Attrative place
review: We visited this place during june 2017 .there was any snow during that time, but it was cloudy and the scenery around .this point  was beautiful.and i want to visit again ..

title: Good cable car ride
review: Cable ride with awsome view of nani lake takes you to about 300 feet above the town.Go carting, riffle shooting for children at the top. Sit and enjoy maggie at the top. A bar is also open.Was a cloudy day thus could not see any snow mountains.

title: At Nainital, this is possibly the best view you can have of the snow-clad Himalayas
review: The Snow View point in Nainital is located on the Kilbury Road, roughly 300 metres above the location of the lake.

title: Over rated
review: It is over rated. If you are travelling to other places after Naintal, you will get more beautiful place to see Himalayas.

title: Good place
review: Cable car ride to this place is interesting. beautiful views of the Naini lake from the cable car. but nothing much to see from the view point. the return trip time will

title: The vista !
review: This place offers the best view of the peaks around here . A great vista point and A great time to click picture would be sunset time for a memorable treat .!Access would be easy if hired a taxi from town . The beauty of the place is bewitching !

title: Naini lake aerial view..
review: Take a ride in a taxi to get a glimpse of naini lakes aerial view from this point, worth to take once..

title: Can't see anything
review: Travelled here with a cable car. But couldn't see any Himalayan range. Its seen only in some months of winter.  Don't expect much here.  They have a kids play zone on top. Over all average

title: It snowed for us
review: When we reached Nainital it was quite past the best time to see snow but the luck on our side it snowed the night we reached.

title: Beautiful view
review: The view from the Snow View point is excellent. One can see the lake and the buildings on the other side of the lake. St. Joseph's College, Sherwood College were clearly visible. We could not see the mountains as there were clouds, but on a clear day the view must be lovely.

title: Amazing views of Himalayan peaks
review: Nice place to spend time viewing Nainital city and surrounding valley. The telescopic view of himalayas are an icing on the cake provided there is no fog. Lot of activities for kids to enjoy. Weather is quite cool here even in summers.

title: Good view from heights.
review: Snow view point in nainital is at good height. You can reach this place either via car through road or the trolley or rope car. For which you need to book tickets atleast one day advance in seasons.

title: Scenic beauty
review: When we visited it was misty but sometime it cleared and provides a view with valley... Lovely walk to the place

title: Snow View
review: The place is very beautiful but in August or off season the place is less beautiful and charming than in winters or in the time of the season.In the season the place is usually filled with snow and you can also have a really good look at the Himalayas

title: Using Ropeway amazing place to view.
review: Very good natural beauty. The ropeway ride to the top is amazing- one can get beautiful views of the Naini lake. However, the whole point of the place- to view snow clad peaks- can only be done during specific times. I tried to see those peaks but all I could see was fog and clouds. had lived great time of life.

title: Village life on top!
review: Due to monsoon season, views of the Himalayan peaks were zilch. However, interesting views over Nainital and the walk down was very revealing in terms of how the villagers live, houses built into the mountainside, children playing on corrugated roof tops, cows, goats roaming freely amongst the friendly locals.

title: Nice view of Himalaya
review: You can take either ropeway or your own vehicle to reach snow view point. I would recommend to take ropeway to see amazing view of Naini lake. If its not the cloudy day then you can see the ice capped himalayas with your naked eye. There is small market where you can have refreshment and small amusement park for children.

title: Disappointing place
review: You should go there without any expectations. 2.5 minute cable car ride was also not much exciting. Could not see anything due to clouds. Locals told that you can view only during October. Other months its very rare.

title: Nice point to visit - if you are visiting 1st time.
review: Does not give you a good view of snow mountains if you are visiting in May or June to beat the summer. However gives you good view of the himalayan range.

title: Nothing much to write about
review: its just a place from where you get to view the himalayan ranges covered with snow...but alas most wont be able to see it in this weather as its cloudy. This is basicallyt a point created by taxi operators...totally avoid it.

title: One of the best view points in Nainital
review: The place was hazy when we got there. But the breeze treated us fairly well. If driving, take precautions on the turns. Also, you may miss the spot during the monsoon haze. Not quite safe for toddlers running around. Dawn visits are recommended

title: Good place
review: We gone there in june 2017. No any snow that time. mostaly croudly there and nothinf peacefull. Should to go in winter or off season.

title: Nice view
review: Great view of the city but steep road to the top would recommend cable car only since driving is risky

title: Nice place
review: We visited this place during may 2017 end,there was any snow during that time, but it was cloudy and the scenery around this point  was beautiful.

title: Great place Bumpy Ride
review: It's a great place to visit if you in Nainital. The view is breathtaking and it's worth the bumpy ride.

title: Dissapointment not at all well maintained
review: This was the biggest dissapointment getting to snow view point and than realizing there is nothing to see around..

title: Only view during October-November
review: There is a huge mess with Horse ride. Never leave a child alone on a horse as the trek is dangerous and there are every chance of children falling down from horse. There is a person with each horse but of no use as the trek is difficult. Even the adults should be cautious enough. At the most one can opt for a ride till the planes and not till the peak. I think the authorities has to take a note of danger involved and ban horse ride for kids. Alternatively the horse saddle has to be custom made for the kids. I am the persons who read this review take a note on it seriously.

title: Typical Tourist Hub
review: Its a typical tourist Hub with over priced eating joints and very limited place to see. One can reach here by road as well as by Ropeway. From here few of the far Off Himalayan peaks are visible through Telescope. One can hire the telescope at this place for Rs 10 to 50/-. One word of caution, these peak are not visible in the summer months due to natural phenomena of formation of haze in the atmosphere.

title: Views only if you are lucky
review: Excellent place to see the snow peaks if the weather permits. Best time to see the peaks according to the locals is between months of October to March when the weather is clear and there is less fog.

title: Beautiful Hill Top
review: Beautiful Spot at the top of hiils and one can view all round n snow clad peaks of Himalaya,one can go by foot n rope way n can enjoy some moments

title: Beautiful views
review: This point offers beautiful views of the Himalayn peaks. One should not miss the visit. It is a nice spot. However people traveling there should keep the place clean. Views are really amazing. Sometimes weather does not allow the views but then one needs to be patient. Eating joints are little expensive, but they are to be expensive due to it's location. It is accessibaloe by road and cable car.

title: nice senery
review: bit crowded with all the tourists going there.

title: Brilliant
review: Though there wasn't snow at this time of the year still the view if the Himalayas is breathtaking and the weather here is so soothing.

title: Good but not excellent
review: You will get better view in Kausani. Here you will get good view of Nainintal lake. You rarely see Himalaya due to fog, cloud etc. You barely see it in naked eyes.

title: Regular Ropeway ride
review: The journey to snow view point is via the Ropeway, the trolley has no place to sit during the journey though. To have a scenic view of the Himalayan range, the skies have to be clear enough. Unfortunately for us, it was not so. There is a small ring market on too with stalls, some with light refreshments, some selling clothes etc, some selling candles nd candle stands.... One can have an aerial view of the lake and Nainital from top.

title: Lucky if it is not a Cloudy day
review: This point is supposedly expected to provide you a snow view spectacle. We could not see anything as the clouds have covered the zone. We went by the ropecar just a 5 minute ride standing (no fun) it was much better in Manasa Devi and Chandi Devi temple ropeway in Haridwar (we could sit and have a view).

title: Just a view point showing the Valley from a height
review: From this point, one can see the view of the valley from a height, looks nice but nothing great that you cannot miss.

title: Great view of Himalayan range
review: Snow View Point can be reached by the rope way. The best time to visit this place is early in the morning when the sky is clear with the rising sun. The view at that time is worth the visit.

title: snow view point visit
review: there was no snow around . there are many

title: Less Chance of getting a view
review: We went to this place in morning at 9:30 am via cable car which itself is strictly average. The place is commercialized with lot of vendors and the top view point , if you are lucky you might get some view, in our case there was all haze , so couldn't view anything.

title: Beautiful place
review: One can experience the complete view of the himalayan mountains from here.Its really awesome. One can spend at least 30 min to admire the scenic view.

title: Waste of time
review: We trudged along to this extremely crowded place trying to by pass the crowds to reach an even more crowded place. Not for the peaceful traveller. But u can spend an evening trying to do stuff here

title: Snow can hardly be viewed - Don't waste time
review: We had also decided to visit that place after climbing the good hight reached there but "Duvidha mein dono gaye - Maya Mili na Ram" Couldn't see the snow as most of the time there is a fog so things cannot be visible. Yes there are some Doobeen wala who was charging Rs.30/- per person to show some places with cooked stories. Nothing is worthwhile to see there it is simply wastage of time and money. Don't go there.

title: No view point!!!!
review: There is no view at this point in summers .. but if you want to experience the cable car ride then just enjoy the same .. otherwise do not expect any view from here..

title: Missed Snow view due to cloudy weather
review: Avoid going to this place on cloudy day, rather go around 10AM when the sky is clear so you can enjoy the mountain and snow views.

title: Highest peak in Nainital
review: It is highest point in Nainital. Also called China peak. Can be reached by horse ride or if you are fit you can track. I enjoyed tracking. It takes an hour to rach. Offers breathtaking view of Nainital city and lake. On clear day Himalaya peaks are seen, But I could not get the opportunity as it was not clearly seen.

title: Just about ok...
review: One of the famous sightseeing points of Nainital... one can use ropeway, cab or feet to reach this destination. If you are lucky you will see snow clad Himalayas. The place is not well kempt. There are some restaurants, KMVN Bar and restaurant, a small fun park with flying fox,  free fall, bumping cars, go carting etc..

title: Know the weather or be disappointed
review: Coming back home to visit, i should have know better. But sunshine doesn't equate to the himalayan view. Well atleast the cable car ride was pretty as always. The walk back to town has always been quiet and serene. The dancing trees and monkeys were good company.

title: View of Himalayan peaks from Nainital
review: The day has to be clear - and typically pre-noon is better - to get a view of the Uttarakhand Himalayan snow-clad peaks. You will get to see Mt. Trishul with naked eye. On a clear day - this is worth a visit. There is a binocular/scope installed at the snow view point and is charged Rs 10 for a minute of viewing.

title: Awesome place
review: Its a mist visit if you are in Nainital. You will get the birds eye view of the entire town. Best to take the cable car to Sbow view and walk down on your return

title: Dream place for photography lovers
review: This place is a dream place for photography lovers and it situated at the top so deep valleys and huge mountains are visible

title: ....if the sky is clear !
review: Accessible by road & also by the rope way, Snow View offers excellent views of the Himalayas, if the sky is clear !

title: Nice view of Hiamalayas
review: This is once of the highest point in nainital, there is a rope way to reach there. view from this point is very very good , better keep a binocular.

title: The beautiful  view
review: It was an amazing  experience  visiting  this place.

title: Mind blowing view!
review: We were lucky enough to get a glimpse of the Thrisul peaks from this point because the clouds had cleared for a few minutes.

title: Not as expectation
review: There is nothing at top except few eating points. It has been commercialized. If you have nothing to do in Nainital then go there.

title: Scenic view of Himalayas
review: Snowview point can be reached by govt. operated ropeway.

title: Must visit, Beautiful view
review: Breathtakingly beautiful view of the Naina peak from the snow view point. Excellent opportunity for getting lots of pics taken with a beautiful background. Various activities are also available nearby like shooting and adventure sports. We booked a car to see 7 different points of Nainital that made this point easily accessible as a trained driver drove us there.

title: Snow point view
review: Good for a view can be missed as not properly maintained adventure park for kids but useless nothing taken care off

title: excellent view
review: You can view excellent high peak covered with snow.  there are telescopes available on very nominal charges.

title: SIMPLY SUPERB
review: Please visit this place by cable car osting Rs.200/- per person.  You are allowed only one hour for view point.  Telescope is installed by private personsto get the full view of the himalyan range. Morning 1030 to evening 1630 hours you can visit.  Better to go in the morning first batch itself to see the snow capped mountains

title: Nothing very special
review: I prefer to go by taxi than ropeway. There is an amusement park, video games, shopping centre to collect momento, food court, a himalayan snow view point in clear weather for lucky ones.

title: Must go place
review: You can easily reach their by cable car, which you can get from Mall road. At the top, you will find Himalayan views on one side and the view of lake and city at the other side. Restaurants over their are also good.

title: Refreshing myself
review: It was surprising for newbi like me. The long view of Himalaya which is been seen only in the pic. Just facing it head to head...

title: Cable car ride!
review: The only thrill is a cable car ride which takes you stop the hill. From the top, if clouds permit and do not mar the horizon, one can see major Himalayan peaks. For the boring lot, you can just cool your heals at any eatery there and enjoy food. Good place for young folks as well.

title: Ropeway is the only attraction
review: You can reach this point through Ropeway which is the only attraction. On the top, there is a telescope (rs. 10 per head) through which they show you the snow clad Himalyas if clouds do not block your view.

title: Scenic views.
review: Access to this view point  through ropeway is the best way, but one can drive up or even trek up from the Mall Road. We were here on a cloudy/ misty day , hence couldn't get to see anything far. But I have seen the snow peaks far away from here on earlier occasions. This view is nothing special for those who have explored Munshiyari or Binsar or Raithal ( Uttarkashi) or any of the interiors of Kumaon or Gharwal. Yet, worth a visit.

title: Snow point
review: It's also a good spot as some amount of snow fall occurs here.Its best to visit this place in the month of November as much snow falling takes place here.

title: Good
review: Couldn't got the complete and perfect view coz of weather.

title: Good Snow View
review: Its just a snow view. You can see snow mountains from there thats it. You can have Maggie with snow view.

title: dont waste your time
review: the taxi drivers would insist you to go here , but actuallyit is a waste of time . most of the mountain peaks are very distant & even telescopes mounted on the side of the road Rs 50/ person are of no use. the view from Mukteshwar, chaukori, munsiyari or kasauni is mesmerizing & visible from naked eye, no need for telescopes to see the HIMALAYAN PANORAMA.

title: Overhyped and commercialised place
review: Good for visiting with family, because they have a mini theme park, you can get there with aireal rope way and meanwhile you can have a great view of naini lake.

title: Amazing view of Himalayan Peaks
review: Do visit this place to look out for Nanda Parbat, Trishul Parbat and many more snow peaks. If you are planning to stay a little longer in Nainital, it is also recommended to visit China Peak. This is only for people who are in love with hills or have an excitement for watching such peaks. The enclosed pics are real and taken from my iPhone.

title: Ok,not satisfied
review: The place really need some improvement,not fit for a tourist visit.there was nothing someone can do to pass time.no activity

title: Excellent with snow
review: It is a nice place to have fun when it is covered with snow. This point can be reached by road as well as by Rope way from Nainital lake

title: Nothing great about the place
review: Its a notmar point from where you can see the himalayas. Some say you can see Siachin from there.! Nothing great at all.

title: Amazing view
review: We have visited the Snow View point last week and the view of this point is amazing, all around was the Snow was lying on the road and the trees both , the trip was amazing after reaching this part of Nainital

title: Awesome view
review: When its about view points its all about the scenery. and believe me guyz, its the best in nainital.

title: Wow
review: Snow point is the best point which I found in the city the best and the hills from there is the best view in the city

title: Ok ok place....
review: If its not snowing, its not tht good place. Dirty snow and not at all safe specially with small kids. Wear good grip shoes and have good clothes.

title: Peaceful Place- Good if you have nothing much to do
review: Nainital is a quiet place - if you are looking for relentless attractions then this is not the place. However, the city has many interesting activities - be it boating in the lake or short treks - everything will make you feel happy and at bliss especially if you are with your family. Visit to snow point is one such activity - they say on clear days you can see the ranges. We were not fortunate enough - but over all it was a lovely experience.

title: View of the majestic Himalayas
review: Its an experience in itself to see the mighty Himalayas standing majestically in front of you! An awesome treat for the eyes!

title: Excellent experience
review: I was really a excellent and memorable moment. You can enjoy the snow here and view the himalayan for here.

title: Excellent & Memorable moments of my life
review: We enjoy the snow fall too much, This is a very memorable moments of our life. Really it was very fantastic point to see and enjoy the ice fall. We spent 2 hours take photos make videos. Every one can enjoy this.

title: See Snow & Hamalya
review: Can see snow through out the year from this point. binoculars are required to see which is chargeable that can be negotiated. Not much to explore there.

title: A ropeway ride to heaven
review: While climbing up on any of the surrounding peaks of Nainital is a heavenly experience, the climb is not easy. However Snow View point is one place you can get to with a rope-way car in minutes and return similarly. Get a view of the entire lake and town through the ride as well as when you reach the top. An essential place to visit for those visiting Nainital. On busy days there is a line up for tickets for the rope way and that is a bit of a nuisance though.

title: It's a wonderful to see Himalaya from that far
review: For people seeing Himalayan snow from a far mountain its beautiful. My family loved it. It was bit rushy though, you have to find a place for your to have nice view.

title: Very nice place to visit in Nainital
review: We had hired a cab (Alto) which took us to 7 different places of interest in Nainital and finally dropped at our hotel. The last and the seventh place we visited was the Snow  View Point. A point with food joints, some rides for kids and a telescope for the view of snow. The cable car also terminates here from Naini lake. When we reached there, It was dusky and cloudy so we could barely have any view. Also the so called telescope was missing :(! But yes we enjoyed the Chai/Maggie there (we were quite hungry by then). Kids were happy to see the rides (could not enjoy them as it was closed by the time we reached there. It is of course a must visit place in Nainital.

title: Snow View Point
review: It is accessible through rope way you can beautiful scene of Nainital Lake and also the Himalayans Mountains covered with snow. There are games also for children

title: I don't Understand why they named this place as Snow view Point
review: There are two ways to reach this place one is rope way and the other is road way by car or bike. To go by rope way one has to a walk little distance from rickshaw stand and buy the tickets for both onward and return which costs Rs.200 PP. As i visited on 31st Dec 2016 and that day is a sunday there is a huge crowd and almost a waiting period of 3 hours. Then i thought as this is last day of the year better end this year with a trek to snow view point. I started the trek at 12.21 pm after purchasing a water bottle and reached the top in almost 1.30 pm which included almost 4 to 5 breaks of 2 to 5 mins each. After reaching this place i was very much excited that i can see snow covered Himalayas but to utter disappointment there is nothing in see-able distance i was very upset and hungry so had my lunch near by restaurant and on my return journey visited the tibbetian monastry and spend some 20 mins there as that place is very quiet which made me stay a little longer and then reached mall road within 15 mins.

title: Panoramic Views
review: You could visit this either by the ropeway or by car. There are two view points - one overlooking the lake and other of Himalayas. The later is restricted only when there are no clouds else its just the valleys.

title: Must Visit Palace
review: U can go via car or via Ropeway. Ropeway cost you 200 Rs for Adult and 160 Rs for above 3 year and less thn 12. Great view of Himalayas from this location, lots of activity for childrens, Maggi Point

title: Looking Good Mountain
review: we visit two time specially for himaliyan mountain in evening not see clearly but morning see mountain very good ..

title: Worth a visit on a clear day.
review: The ride using the Ropeway is well managed and gives unique views of the lake and surrounding hills. So I would say this is better than taking a taxi up.

title: must go in nainital
review: you can either stay at KMVN snow view hotel (a heritage building converted to hotel) or take the ropeway...

title: Mountains with snow...
review: When I visited this place this place was covered with snow. I love the beauty of it. I was thrilled with view I got to see there. It was fun to play in snow with friends. I will keep vivstong this place in future aswell.

title: Place is very good.
review: Place is quite goood. Must visited place and enjoy that place. Has nice view and place is very good.

title: Dull place, good views
review: After the trek to Tiffin top all the way a day before, we thought taking cable car for snow view. Only the cable car was the enjoyable part of the visit to Snow View point where you get to see eye-shaped Naini lake from height. Nothing else. On top, there are shops selling knick knacks, toys, game shops and some places to eat. There were many stray dogs chasing each other which was kinda scary for some tourists.

title: what a lovely view
review: its great location and scintillating view of nanda devi range. worth visiting place for himalaya lovers

title: Nice view of nainital
review: Here they claim that we can see himalyas but its very hard to see as due to fog or bad weather. May be clear whether can help. But nice view

title: calm and serene
review: its real charm of Nainital. the old grandeur of nainital is visible in viceroy house, which is turned into govt hotel now.

title: Snow view
review: Just go and see himalayan range directly you will love it requires stair climbing and there are lots of game for kids which they will love.

title: Good views on a clear sky day
review: Luckily, the sky was very clear the morning we went there. Vendors are there who provide telescope for good close up views at a nominal charge.

title: Stunning Landscapes
review: Good view of Snow clad mountains of himalays from this point. journey to this place by road is also very picturesque. there are telescopes availaible to view the Himalayas at nominal rates of Rs 50/ person must visit place during travel to nainital

title: Excellent view of the snow covered peaks of Himalayas
review: Can be visited by an interesting trek or by cable car

title: Good view of Himalayas
review: You can reach snow point using a cable car. One can see Himalayan peaks provided there is clear weather. There are vendors who charge nominal fees for telescope viewing.

title: Just another Point of Hill Station
review: Not worth visiting. We visited and were utterly disappointed. The view it offers can be viewed from any other top in nainital.

title: good view
review: If you go in winters than you will be able to see the snow otherwise not its on the top of nainital.Must visit

title: Not worth the money
review: One has practically no option but to go by rope way.there is nothing to see while on roe way or from snow view point.

title: Short trip of nainital
review: It is easily accessible and well connected with nainital just 11 km far away from Nainital.

title: its okie okie point,
review: this point is worth while only if the weather is clear and  then only you can  see himalayan range, or else, it utter waste going up

title: Not Exactly Worth It
review: You wait your turn for a long time only to reach the top to find restaurants and video games and noise. The best view is only while going up the cable. Up there only one spot gives you good views test is pretty much useless from the thickness of the forests

title: Place at top
review: Snow view point offers spectacular views of the snow clad of Himalayas.Located about 3 kms away from the main township of nainital,the spot can be reached by adventurous hilly trek or a comfortable taxi ride.Nature lover and Kids should visit this place.

title: Beautiful views
review: The best time to visit is between 8-10 in the morning as you will be able to see most of the Himalayan Peaks from there.

title: Snow flaked mountains from Nainital
review: Went in Nov,2016. We took private car for sight seeing in INR 500 and it showed us 7 points and this was one of them. On high hill top reaching there was exciting. In front lies the all snow covered mountains..Good scenic beauty

title: see snow
review: Nainital itself a very good hill station during summer season in India. This is the place where you can stay for a 15 day and enjoy visiting different locations. This is one of such location you have to visit this point early in the morning say 4.30 to 5.30 am to see snow

title: Killer View
review: This is one of the best view point in Nainital. The only way to reach to this mesmerizing place is through ropeway .

title: Definitely NOT a Must-See Place
review: The only thing exciting about the visit to the Snow View point is experiencing the ropeway ride. The place is also accessible by local cabs who claim to take you to a few other scenic spots n less than the amount you pay for the cable car ride. The charges are actually steep at 200 rupees for an adult and 130 rupees for a child. However, the view you get while going up and coming down is priceless. On the top there is a badly maintained amusement park and a couple of shabby eateries. If you are lucky and the weather is clear, you may see a few snow-clad peaks. Otherwise there is nothing spectacular to see from this place.

title: Should have been spectacular but missed it...
review: Snow view gives an incredible view of the Himalayan Range and it is one of the few points where tourists flock to enjoy the scene. However, the exact spot for view is at a curve of the road and not an observatory type area.

title: Just a place at top of mountain
review: At top of the mountain. A scenic place .. not appreciated by all. Lots of eating joints for snacks . Reaching here by road is difficult .

title: Amazing View
review: One of the must visit places in Nainital. If you like trekking then walk up- a walk in the woods. However, if are are lazy types then take the ropeway, 200 rs for return ticket. The view of Nainital from top as also view of himalayas is great. Plan according to cloud cover as on a hazy day you may not be able to see much

title: ViewPoint for Himalayas
review: You can view Himalayas from here if the sky is clean and there is no Fog. Locals told us that from November the view is clear.

title: Overhyped view
review: While the walk/trek to this point is actually the most enjoyable part of the trip to this Point, on reaching there is the biggest disappointment!! Apart from people hanging on with telescopes to help you view the snow capped mountains, there is nothing there... actually the view can be seen from other vantage points in Nainital and even on the way up.... plus of course from other hill stations including Ranikhet, Binsar,Mukteshwar etc.

title: just a idiotic place
review: There are some people over their have telescope to show you the himalaya and military camp which is a waste at cloudy weather.

title: Best views of the Himalayas - closest to the plains
review: This spot is the closest to the plains to see the eternal snows in the high Himalayas. Of course views are dependent on the weather, Autumn the most spectacular.

title: Nice view of the snow capped mountains
review: The snow view point can be accessed by the ropeway close to the Nainital lake on the Mall road. It is located in a bylane which can be bit difficult to locate. The view from the top is amazing.

title: Good Vivew
review: very good view from this point for himalya snow amazing sean from this point to himalaya ,very beutyful sean to himayalaya shnow

title: Snow view point only clouds
review: Himalayan mountain range was not visible as it was covered with thick layer of clouds. The view was beautiful even though there was no trace of snow covered himalayas. So it was ok to go there as their are not many places to visit in Nainital town. To reach this place you can go by a taxi, bike which will take you to the exact location. Other option is the cable car trolley which takes you up and then you need to walk to the snow view point. Cable car takes 200 rs for bothways. You can travel one way also for ₹130. We took a car ro visit 7 tourist places of nainital  for rs 500. He left us at cable car point and we rode back to mall road by cablecar.

title: Snow view point
review: It is located in nanital and you can see snow in winter. You get lovely and very beautiful view. of nanital and lake. It is quite picturesque.

title: Worth a visit
review: This is the 3rd best thing to do in Nainital after boating and lovers point(lands end, tiffin top and Dorothy seat).

title: Snow point
review: The one of the best location in Nainital.. When you come here in winter there was a good view.. Awesome

title: Bad weather
review: It's probably nice if the weather is nice. Unfortunately, I can't say much about that but what I can say is that it's a nice walk up to the top. Some stunning views on the way (when it was not so cloudy for a few minutes)

title: Zero Visibility in August
review: According to Trip advisor user reviews, most of the people visited this place between June to August. But when i went there on 21st August, all the peaks are completely covered with clouds and visibility was less than 100 metres.

title: Great to view the snow clad peaks of Himalaya
review: It is a great place if you want a glimpse of the Himalayas. However, the peaks will be visible only if it is a non-cloudy day. I remember seeing them on a childhood trip with family in the month of July.

title: view
review: A good view of the town. It is on top of the hill. Accessible by ropeway. So reaching the point is not an issue. You can loiter round and enjoy the fresh air as long as wants. Normally the ropeway guys gives you an hour or so stroll around which is more than adequate

title: Visit only in winters
review: I visited this place in mid of September and there was Nothing...

title: bad
review: worst experience.

title: Good to visit... Just a birds view of city...Snow view only if you are lucky
review: The best time to visit this place and get a good view of snow is winter upto March. During sunny days the fog covers the mountains and you dont  get any snow hills view from top or this place. Hence it is recommended to avoid this spot in case you are not interested to go there and enjoy the view of valleys from top or view the far points through telescope paying some Rs 20. I suggest it's becoming a child again seeing through the telescope and also the person would earn some money; hence do enjoy seeing through telescope. The other places on this hills like Khurpa tal and lover's point / Loner's point is a good visit place and you can enjoy the Butta, local fruits or few sips of tea here. In case your driver is not aware of places and you have space in your vehicle it is suggested to take a guide who are readily available mall road.

title: One of the Himalays glimpse points at Nainital
review: If your interest is to have a glimpse of Himalayas, then this is one of points in Nainital to do that. Accessible by way of cable car. Himalays can be viewed with a aide of telescope available at this place.

title: Good to Visit
review: One can get to see the snow view of the mountains only when one goes in the right season. Otherwise you can just see the bird's eye view of Nainital

title: A clean and quick view point
review: Well it's a view point very jam packed situated at a very narrow road highway towards the bird sanctuary.. so I advise to get your vehicle parked properly before getting out of it.. also it is only advisable for youngsters and children should be in proper care before stepping out.. as there is no fencing in this view point.. it should be avoided in case of huge rush..

title: nice view specially in winter
review: this is the place from where the all nainital looks like snowy because it covers with the snow in winter time.

title: Scene
review: Must avoid Muradabad-(Rampur to Rudrapur)-Nainital road stretch as it is filled with ponds of water. Take Muradabad-Kashipur-Kaladungi -Nainitaal. It is bit longer but good driveway.

title: wonderful visit
review: great view of mountain range and nearby himalyan seight always covered with snow ,telescopic enjoyment.

title: Nice place and nice view
review: One of the best place yo visit in Nainital. View is awesome and temperature is low as compare to lake side. Best way to enjoy is staying here rather just giving it a visit.

title: A lot of activities
review: Well visit to the snow view point by cable car is one of the attractions of nainital. There is a significant rush during season time and it is possible that you might get tickets for the next day. Costing 200 for adults and 130 for kids but you have to go standing in the trolley with 10 other people and get 1 hr to spend here.

title: snow view
review: At the top,a close up viw of Nanda Devi(7816m),which was the highest mountain in the British empire.It is second highest peak in India after Kanchenjunga sikkim.

title: Views from it are excellent.
review: It should be a must when visiting Nainital. The recreation and nature viewing is good above the hill.

title: Not much to do!
review: High altitude point over looking entire Nainital, which can be accessed via a rope way based in the center of town. Reached around 10 when the rope way began operations and soon got very crowded with long waiting lists. To & Fro times are determined at the ticket counter.

title: A must but nothing spectacular
review: It is a point from where you can view naintal lake. Snow view of peaks are difficult as those are clouded during day time. You have 3 options to go. 1 Cable car; 2. car. 3. walking. 1 is preferred. There is a KMVN hotel for stay. I do not recommend as Tallital KMVN is better.

title: Himalaya view
review: You can only see snow the weather is good either you can not see this snow because most of weather of Nainital is not clear

title: For Winter Attraction
review: this is very good spot.But if u r going in winter then and then only u can see himalayas otherwise u cant see snow view.But yes, in between the way there is one point where whole nainital is see with lake and that view is amazing.

title: jgj
review: nice place to view

title: Avoid during rainy weather
review: Nanda devi and adjoining Hills are visible only if weather is clear and it's a waste of time in case there are lot of clouds which was the case during our visit.

title: Didn't like it much
review: Snow view point has nothing. It is just you can see now mountains which are really very far from nanital. You can maggie here and get some clicks. Thats it. Not much recommended place.

title: adventure
review: nice place to visit and adventure activities are there like go karting and for kids its a fun place..we saw himalayan range from binocs. an gud view of whole nainital

title: Its just something to do.
review: If you are in Nainital, then this is just something to do for sightseeing lovers. Though most of the time snow capped peaks would not be seen but still rope way ride could be thrilling for many.

title: ''Himalaya View''
review: Snow view 2270 MT About 3 kms from the town and also accessible via a Cable Car, Rope Way. Snow view is one of the most visited tourist spots of the town.If weather is clear can see Himalaya. Lots of fun place & eateries were there.

title: No view of Snow from Snow view point
review: I do not recommend these places as you just be spending exorbitant amount on taxi fare to visit few sightseeing in Nanital but my recommendation is Nani lake, Mall road, Caves and Naina devi apart from relaxing in hotel.

title: Great Place
review: Good views can enjoy roapway. Can see complete nainital from here. Heritage hotel is good here. Can book through KVMV.

title: No Snow View
review: Though we were disappointed as there was nothing like snow view. But we found it very peaceful and had spent some memorable hours with family & friends.

title: Could not see the snow peaks
review: Most of the tourist attractions in Nainital are quite a sham with the cab drivers creating a 7 point package out of pretty much nothing.

title: Decent place
review: Visited this place thru the ropeway. could not see the snow as there were too many clouds during our visit. Missed the major view in that sense. The place otherwise is filled with small small entertainment stuff, mostly for children and teenagers.

title: Not Worth....
review: Go By Car; No View of Snow Was Seen ; Just Ate Maggie There With Cold Drink And Came Back.... Nothing Special....

title: Need Luck to see Himalays
review: The location is very ideal to have a view of the Himalayas. The spot is ideal when the sun rises, however we could not see it even though we went twice. It all depends on the clouds. You can only see if if it is clear

title: GOOD HIGH POINT TO VIEW HIMALAYAS, IF THE SKY IS CLEAR
review: We engaged a car in the morning to go to this point, among others, to see the Himalayan range of mountains.  We were excited.  After a fairly long drive from our resort, we reached this point.  There were several yellow-coloured long telescopes ranged and operated by enthusiastic men to show the mountains for a fee.  We tried to see them with our naked eyes but could only see hazy contours far beyond.  The misty sky played mischief.  We were somewhat disappointed but the drive was worthwhile and the few minutes spent there were exhilarating. .

title: Best View of Nainital
review: This is a place on height from where you can view the beauty of Nainital. A good place for Photography also.

title: Nice ride to top
review: This place would be good if yu are able to see the snowy peaks but due to the forest fire it was not visible.  Even other wise its a dry place with an amusement park.  But the cab ride to the top is thrilling.  The cable car was not working on the day we went otherwise that option too will add to the thrill

title: Not good
review: Snow view point is a main point in nainital visit but I don't like the place. There are some boys will ask to see the far view from binoculars and there is nothing to see from there. There were no view of snow point or Himalaya in may month.

title: Okay.. but no snow view
review: One of the highest points in Nainital, you have a view of the valley below. But the snow is hidden by haze... the ropeway / cable car was not running on Saturday when I went, but sign posted as 200RS for round trip ride.

title: Himalayan View
review: On a clear day you can see the entire Himalayan range from here. A lovely place to go using the rope way. Lot of eateries and attractions for children.

title: Good view point of Nainital
review: Enjoy small eating points in good weather. Nice view of hills from this point. Go through stairs if you are comfortable..

title: Great Himalaya view
review: If weather is clear can see Himalaya. Can take rope way. Lots of fun place & eateries were there. we enjoyed the formula one type racing there

title: Good place to see nanda devi peak.
review: We had a bit of bad luck I would say as clouds covered the peak view. We only had a quick view of the peak but it got covered suddenly after 5 minutes by huge clouds and we waited for 30 minutes and had tea with maggie in the mean time, but the clouds were there till the time . Though it was only for 5 minutes but the view of the peak was great.

title: View Trishul and Nanda Devi
review: Just 5 Kms off Nainital, this high point provides you some breathtaking views of the Himalayas esp the Trishul peaks and also Nanda Devi- the second highest mountain peak in India (after Kanchanjunga)

title: Snow Point
review: I visited the snow point in the first week of Apr.  The view of the Himalayas was awesome and the place was reasonably clean.  A great item on the bucket list for Nainital.  The snow point is accessed by either the ropeway or a taxi.  We were told that the ropeway was not operational, by a travel salesman on the mall road, although it was not true.  We therefore took a taxi and paid Rs.650 to see seven places of which one was the snow view point.  The snow view point is a great place to visit.  But since we did it with the taxi, we also saw the other views of the lakes and cliffs.  It was after all a good lie after all to sell the taxi trip!!

title: Definitely Worth a Visit
review: Unfortunately due to haze, we could not see the snow-capped Himalaya peaks. But through the telescopes, for a small payment, we were shown some distant and nearby attractions. Probably in colder season, on a clear day the view would be better. Overall view of the valley is breathtaking.

title: Good views
review: Nice good place. Good views of the himalayas. Better to go in the winters though when there is actually some snow

title: Average visit.
review: You can reach here by a taxi or by a cable car from the mall road. I went thru the cable car and they charged Rs. 200 per head. When you reach there, you can see himalayas through powerful binoculars by payment of Rs. 10. You will be able to see himalayas if you are lucky as view is sometimes filled with haze. There are various games for children on the top for enjoyment on payment basis. I thought chrging for the cable car should have been enough and all the fun and frolic above should be free. For me this place is just an average place. Also mind you just have only one hour to complete your stay on the top.

title: Snow  view point
review: visited the place through the trolley after 2 hrs. waiting period. one can see almost all nainital from there. Could not see the either the snow or Himalaya. enjoyed free fall and car bumping. nice place for fun loving people. children can enjoy there.

title: himalayas in your eyes
review: its refreshing to see the snow filled himalaya, its good to see and if the weather allows , you will get a fabulous view

title: Must go place for every vistors
review: Try to visit there in Morning to Afternoon time other wise you won't see snow pick mountains. Avoid this place if you are travelling with old person.You can see aerial view of the nainilake. A fun place for every kids. Ropeway cost Rs. 200 for bothway ride for 1 person.

title: Must Visit
review: A must Visit place. You will fall in love with this place. You could see the Himalaya from this point (Nov-March) and in other season if you are lucky and can get up soon then upto 7 Morning.

title: Suitable For Tourists
review: Take Rope way after going almost 100 stairs on hill, the point has many option, zip lining, go karting, baby bungee, small food points, bumping cars, at top you have binocular view of 6 points (not visible on cloudy days). There is also a temple.

title: Don't hesitate. Just go for it
review: Take a ropeway from mall road.. There is a small restaurant at the top. Have some snacks and then get ready for some adventure. There are a lot of amazing things at the top for u and your kids(if they are with u) Free fall, go karting, flying fox are some of the games that you can enjoy...the best of them is the Free fall...it just takes you at the top of the world and it allows you to enjoy anti-gravity (weightlessness) :) after that you can try some video games and refresh your childhood memories..try shooting some bottles with rifles and pistols and ultimately gaze at the beautiful lake as well as the snowy Himalayas. Best of luck :)

title: nothing great here
review: except the cable car ride, nothing much to do here. the peaks are not visible. can be avoided if u r not much into cable car rides.

title: Spectacular view of the Himalayas
review: A cable car ropeway with an apporx.5-10 minute ride takes you atop this place. Even though only  slightly higher than where the mall road is located, the place is much cooler.

title: great view point
review: great view point, to get there we took the cable car- its quiet old.

title: best view
review: from snow view point I with my friends clicked pictures had maggie there n enjoyed the beauty of the scene there..

title: More like view the Himalays point !!
review: Its a simple view point where you can see the snow clad himalayan mountains. If you want to visit it, go early in the morning for the best view

title: Average
review: I would say visit the place just to experience the cable car. Bit nothing much happening in the place as such. The time we went was late afternoon and could not even see the snow peaked mountains. We did have kumoan food at the Governer's house. The food was awesome..

title: Must visit place.
review: Be it for children, couple, friends, family this place holds good for any type of visitors. It is a must visit place for all visiting Nainital. You need to go by trolley. They will give you two way tickets valid for one hour. You go up have some slightly expensive snacks like Maggie momos etc, play games, have fun with some of amusement rides like Free Fall and comeback in an hour. If you visit this place by October you'll get to see The great Himalayas from there.

title: Wonderful views
review: On a clear day Snow View Point offers a great view of the Indian Himalaya including Nandi Devi, India's second highest mountain

title: Disappointed
review: Going up by ropeway,noticed that trolleys were shabby & not maintained well.Dirty control panels could be safety hazard for the ride.Up on the snow point,one could notice total neglect of the area.The view point could have been better designed for view of Himalayan peaks & comfort of visitors.Disappointed with neglect.

title: Good spot
review: You need to go by ropeway, which is awesome experience! Snow view is good and if no fog it could be clear

title: Far away from Mall Road
review: I have booked this hotel through oyo rooms and stay on 27th Dec 2015. Its far from mall road and you have to take cab to drop (changes will be around 250-300) if you are staying beyond 6 PM. Yes, you have the rope way near by but its only available till 5:30 - 6:00 PM. I will not recommend this hotel specially to family.

title: NOTHING TO SEE
review: To reach this place you have to go in a cable car... After reaching there don't expect too much because you will find nothing at all. After climbing at a certain height you will find a guy standing with just one binocular and with that you will have to search a mountain peak covered in the blanket of clouds.... Go if you have lots of time to waste.

title: Snow view or Rope way....
review: This point is more of a value to ENJOY ROPE WAY....... Must ... Must  ..... Visit using Rope way......  View Himalayan Snow and get Thrill.... MUST Visit Jammu & Kashmir Handloom Emporium...... Really Good Items you can trust and buy....

title: Just like any other peak at hill stations
review: Since Nainital is more about the lake at nearby places so all these peaks are kind of over-rated by the local tour operators. If you keep the expectations realistic then this place offer good view, a little play area for kids and some good place to rest and look around; though nothing great as such.

title: Average Place
review: Average place. Although the snow capped mountains could be seen but the view is not so spectacular. Not much done here although the restaurant nearby had good food options

title: Himalaya Darshan
review: One can reach the place by rope way or by car. By car it's adventurous because of sharp hair pin curves of road. From the view point the mighty Himalaya range is clearly visible. The main three peaks can be viewed very nicely with the help of binocular by paying a nominal fee. Although the range is almost 1000 kms away, the snow white peaks are clearly visible.

title: Ok ok view
review: From nainital one need to take rope way to reach snow view point. Ropeway charges was 150 for adult and 100 for children. Waiting period to get into the ropeway may go upto 2 hours depending upon the rush.

title: View is good in the morning
review: Like any view point one has to reach here early to enjoy the view. Rope car ride is good as it gives a different view of place. At top a ill maintained theme park kind. Very old.. Go kart is decent for kids.. otherwise nothing much to do. Just enjoy rope car and come back.

title: snow view point
review: to go to snow view point you have to take rope way from here you can enjoy a clear view of himalya by the help of binocular which is situated here

title: Must Visit
review: Make sure you visit this place first as visibility becomes low after 11.00. You can either go by rope way (which is easiest) or by road. Please remember small cars can easily reach, as roads are too narrow.Always ask locals, its hard to spot the correct turn (there are even shortcuts if you are bike). There is also a second view point just below the main view point.

title: AMAZING VIEW OF SNOWLADEN HIMALYAS
review: Visited Snowview point by cable car in November 2015. The ropeway ride is asesome with lot of capacity .Management is good at times of rush. The view of Naini hills from the cable car is experienced to be believed. At snowview point one gets excellent view of snowladen Himalyan peaks . One can use binoculars for zoomed view. Fresh breeze at top of the hill is another plus. Would like to visit agian whenever get a chance to visit Nainital.

title: Looks good in snowfall
review: If you want to enjoy the Trolley ride go for it otherwise In Normal, it is an average place with some eateries around.   BUT In Snow Season the same place looks stunning with hot snacks around.

title: Good view ...
review: It can take a bit of an effort if one has to walk up there, however, we had a car.  It is alright to use those binoculars for a better view ..

title: Combo of Adventure and Natural beauty...
review: 1. One can go through rope-way or taxi/car. rope-way cost 150 rs per person and is valid for 1 hour only.

title: Nice look at the mighty himalayas
review: Snow view point - also called as the Himalaya Darshan - is definitely a place worth visiting on Nainital trip.

title: best
review: i was see the everst nanda devi , trishul , and one more, two way for reach this pleace one by trali car. pay the 400rs for 2 person and other way by car.i think car is best for this. iwas used both ways

title: Stunning Views
review: One of the must to go points in Nainital. You can reach at the Snow view point by ropeway. Riding in the ropeway itself is a very amazing experience because you can take a panoramic view of the city.

title: No snow. No view
review: This was my terrible experience for me. When we went through rope way spending 120/- per person. We found no snow. All we saw was Himalya with snow 1000 km away from our location. :( You might enjoy some games at the top like gun shooting, archery etc.

title: Time and your Luck matter to make it a true pleasure
review: Well if sky is clear and you have managed to reach there  (by car or walk) then you will vitness the view of  the majestic himalayan range of Nanda and two other peaks. Its marvellous to watch it with bare eyes and through a telescope arranged nearby by locals and govt sometimes.

title: Breathtaking views
review: The first excitement is to reach this point by a cable car.

title: snow view point
review: To reach there you have to take cable car .here they have arranged a binocular .with its help you will get a clear cut view of himalaya fully covered by ice

title: Stunning views of the himalayas
review: It can be worth getting your way up to the snow view point. The views are just stunning, overlooking the Himalayan ranges. This is something you shouldn't miss out when in Nainital. It can be freezing cold at this point, just make sure you have all the right clothing to support you. The feeling is awesome, just get mesmerized by the raw beauty of this place.

title: View of Himalayan hills
review: This is one of the main sightseeing place in Nainital & it is near Naina devi temple.To reach ticket counter you have to walk through a steep road which may be tiresome for elderly persons.During holidays it may take about 5-6 hours to get your turn to board the cable car which is not advisable as you may have to skip other picnic spots due to short of time.The interesting part is travelling by cable car which gives a beautiful view  of the lake & nainital.There is a telescope provided at top to view the hills.This snow view is possible only at certain timings & seasons.If you have already travelled by cable car & not the proper season better to skip this place particularly if you are an elderly person

title: View of the White Himalayas
review: Getting to the Snow View Point itself is a great drive with beautiful views of the entire Nainital city and the mountains. A must visit for all the nature lovers with an added cherry of the view of the greater Himalayas

title: Must visit
review: To reach snow view point u have to take ropeway (cable car) from Mall Road. It cost 150 rs both sides. From snow view point u can see the himalyan ranges and there are people renting a pair of bionocular to see the range.  There a coffee shops and joy rides.  One should book the only hotel on snow view point that GMVN government hotel for one day if u are a nature lover. Its a must visit place.

title: Great views
review: The Snow View Point is a must visit for all the nature lovers especially in winters since one can see the fresh snow all around. The drive may be a little tricky due to the slippery roads however there is nothing to worry. The mighty greater Himalayan peaks visible from the snow view point are towering and a very humbling experience.

title: View Great Himalayan Range
review: If touring in winters, Hiimalayan range is visible whole day on a clear day. Breathtaking views. Paisa wasool!!!!

title: Quite serene view
review: We got a nice view of the snow capped mountains. It gets really warm on a sunny day. Just roam around and soak up the sun and breathe in the fresh clean air.

title: Great view of the snow clad Himalayas
review: The place offers a good view of the snow covered Himalayan ranges, provided the weather / sky is clear..

title: Amazing & Panoramic views
review: Excellent views of Himalayas. Can see snow laden peaks of Himalayas of 21000 ft height. Good camera is necessary to take great pic. Private Telescopes are available but not of good quality

title: Enthralling View of Mighty Himalayas
review: If you happen to visit during the Oct-Nov period and be lucky to have a clear sky you will treated with the divine and enlightening view of the majestic Himalayas.

title: beautiful place/point
review: a bit far from nainital but worth visiting place. You can see beautiful himalayan peaks covered with snow from this point. also can hire telescope to view mukteshwar temple (25-30 per head)

title: Enchanting views of Himalayas
review: This spot on a clear day provides some really enthralling views of snow clad Himalayas.

title: the cable car ride is good. most probably must visit during snow time only.
review: The cable car ride to the top is fantastic. Since i visited in october, there was no snow.  Nothing great about the view from top.  There was only a childrens park, with also go karting.

title: Excellent place to view the snow-peaks in Nainital
review: This is a place which you should not miss out. You can hike up to the point. The road condition is good and shaded by tall pine trees. Or you can take the cable car. The cable car opens service at 10 AM and closes at around 4-5 PM. INR 150 is the charge for adults and INR 100 for children. Each cabin of the cable car can hold at a time 10-11 people(825 Kg). You are allowed to stay for 1 hour on the top and then come back.The journey by ropeway will take about 5-7 minutes to reach the top.
