Excellent aerial view of Nainital can be enjoyed from the cable car. The snow view top is buzzing with activity. Bungee jumping, Trampoline, Go-Karting, Free fall can be enjoyed with tickets costing in a range of INR 100-200 per activity. Kid's rides are also present. Several eatery and decorated small gardens are not rare. At the summit the snow peaks are visible. A binocular is present to offer closer view at the cost of INR 10 per minute. Also 'aim and shoot' activity thrives on the snow view top. 8 bullets for INR 20. You need to target hanging plastic and glass bottles!

title: OK OK
review: we didn't see the snow view, so maybe it was not the right time..just had a walk over there..and couple of photos

title: Excellent view of Himalayan Mountain Range...
review: This spot gives you a very picturesque view of entire Himalayan Mountain Range.

title: Cable car ride and peacefull view
review: When we went it was fun, peaceful, and clean while the views were a little underwhelming. There was an abandoned amusement park and it was sunset. I would like to think there are better times of year and day to visit. Enjoyed the ride.

title: Gud view
review: You can view himalayas from here by paying rs.20 for binoculars....it is a great view of himalayas....you will enjoy....MUST GO

title: To the Snow View point via the Ropeway
review: One important thing to note is that the Ropeway tickets are limited. One local policeman was kind enough to share the information with us. The best way of doing this is that after you reach the Mall Road, first buy the Ropeway tickets from the office and then go for your visit to Naina Devi Temple and the boatride on the Lake. We bought the tickets at around 11.30 am and got the 3.10 pm ropeway slot. So we went to the temple and the boatride and were back well in time for the 3.10 pm ropeway trip when we saw some disappointed tourists who couldn't get tickets as they had reached late.

title: Good time pass.
review: If you have time in Nainital, you can visit this point. However in afternoon Himalayas are generally hidden behind with clouds and you would not be able to see them.

title: super view
review: Excellent. We had a clear sky. went in around 9:15AM..Almost first ones to take the rope way...had an excellent view of Himalayas....

title: Not worth visiting.
review: Once you see the Naini Peak and Tiffin Peak this place then won't mesmerize you anymore. Just could be visited for a rope way ride.

title: Snow View - Old Govy House Naini
review: A great view of the Himalayas greets the lucky visitor . Go on a clear morning and enjoy a panoramic view of  snow laden peaks in the far distance . Binoculars on  pay basis available for a better viewing .  For those not willing to walk  to Snow View take the cable car which provides stunning views of Naini Lake as your climb the mountain . ( ticket is for a to and fro ride). Small games for kids are available  including rifle shooting , flying fox and go carts. For the sturdy one can walk from here to Naina  Peak

title: Beautiful for a urban man
review: I have never in my life seen a snow peak mountain in my life in person. When my car turned to the side where i could see the view, I shouted WOW! They call this Himalayan Darshan Point. Ha ... beautiful Himalayas. They show the Trishool parvat, and some other main mountains through telescope here. Must Visit If you are in Nainital. Actually if it is snowing, you cannot even go to the point, I was said. Also you should go either early mornings or evenings to have a clear sky to see. Afternoon it becomes cloudly as the sun rises up.

title: Nothing much except Ropeway experience
review: We reached snow view point by ropeway.charges of ropeway are 150 & 100 for adults & children.As there are many trees so there is no view of Himalayan.however u can see few areas by telescope at top by paying Rs.20.

title: Amazing View!
review: Great views on offer! This attraction offers a view of the snow capped Himalayan peaks in the distance. Do ensure you visit this place when there's clear weather, else it's not worth it.

title: Nothing much really
review: There are two ways to reach this point from Mall Road. One is a taxi which will take you all way up and another is through a ropeway where you have to stay up for about an hour and then are required to come back.

title: Snow view point via cable car.
review: The only good thing is the cable car ride. It is advisable to purchase tickets a day in advance as in tourist season; the tickets gets sold out within an hour or so. You can reach snow view point by your car also.

title: average
review: access this point using ropeway. they will give u 1 hrs. as snowvew is concern..visit in the morning before12am. if u miss the snow, there are other activity to enjoy..shooting,fun park,few shopps,horse ride..etc

title: Simply overhyped
review: Don't let the guide make a fool out of you. This place is simply over-hyped.It is a small building that allows you to take a view of Himalayas (albeit it is a clear weather). On normal days the hills are not even visible and what you end up doing is spending money on eating Maggie at hill top. Even Maggie has eluded this place.

title: too good
review: the place is on top of the hill from where we can see the view of Naini lake

title: If you are lucky you may see snow capped mountains
review: The view of snow capped mountains is not assured everyday and every time. So don't go with that as the sole aim. If that's there let it be a bonus. You can take the rope way if you have not tried it earlier elsewhere (Rs 150 per head for a return trip within one hour). It gives a good view of Naini Tal (lake and town) from above. There are a few shops, rides etc at the top and maybe you could see the mountains too. There is the option to go by road also and take a small trek.

title: Very Nice View
review: Fantastic snow covered mountain views during clear days. Place is easily accessible via road and rope way. Overall nice experience.

title: View of Snow capped Himalayas
review: This location offers view of Snow capped Himalayas.One can also look at the Himalayas thro'  Telescope paying fee to the vendors.Beautiful view.

title: Almost 180 degree view of snow capped himalayan peaks
review: Pristine view of the snow capped himalayan peaks. The place is a little commercialised, but worth it.

title: Journey is more beautiful  than the destination
review: We reached the snow view point via the ropeway. The journey back and forth had spectacular views. On the snow view point there are a few shops which try to rip you off. You can put on costumes and take photos. The view isn't all that great though.

title: Must Go
review: Reward yourself with hill side tea. One can Get a great View of the Himalayas covered full of Snow.Amazing View.

title: Doesn't live upto its name
review: There's no view. It's completely blocked by trees. You have to search for a vantage point to even see the road. Not worth it

title: mountain is calling
review: very very beautiful place. lots of fun ,rides food court, awesome views, peaceful place. you can see Himalayan view from here

title: It does not justify the name
review: Like the tile says, it does not justify the name. Too many commercial outlets there now. If you want to see a snow peaks, go to Kausani. If you want the whole Nainital lake view, go to China Peak.

title: Not worth it
review: It is a hard place to find and the local guides cum taxi drivers will lure you into going here, but to be honest, you won't miss anything if you don't go here. There is nothing much to see. It is just one of those points where you can go and just have some peace of mind that you did see this place

title: Average
review: Travelled through roapway.  Very average. If clear sky , you can view the snow clad Himalaya. It has few fun games at the top which you can enjoy.

title: Breathtaking View....
review: Going to the point is itself so romantic... with the cable car slowly moving up leaving behind the gorgeous lake & all the greenery... Approaching the highest point in Nainital... the cool breeze at the top brushing your skin... it was just awewome... The sad part is that we couldnt have a view of the snow due to the clouds...

title: Travelled through ropeway to have awsum view of Nanital
review: One can have good view of Nanital from far end point of Snow view point.Went there by ropeway so kind of experience there too.There is a bful temple too

title: check before u go
review: If the weather is foggy than there is no point going there as u wont be able to see anything except fog and your journey to this place will not be a fruitful one , so please check before planning to visit this place.

title: Amazing Snow View Himalayan Peaks
review: Its accessible through a rope way . From Mall road its walk-able to the rope way . Amazing journey to the top . You will be rewarded with the amazing view of the snow capped Himalayas from the top . Really worth a visit.

title: CLOUDY
review: The clouds did not allow us a clear view of the mountains.....  we were told that the view could be much better

title: Amazing point to hangout with family and friends
review: Nothing better then getting the full view of nainital city from hilltop and reching there by trolley cable...yes, its snow view point.

title: Clouds
review: Well the place seems to be good but in our case it was too cloudy and couldnt get anything to view. Disappointment !! The ropeway is good but have to wait a lot to get a ride.Overall worth visiting once.

title: A peak with a view
review: Crack of dawn walk recommended. Reward yourself with hill side tea and boiled eggs. Life is made enjoyable with these little yet abundant pleasures.

title: Good Place
review: Take a cab and visit this place to view the snow capped peaks.Must visit if you are only visiting nainital and not going to other places like kausani, Choukori.

title: must visit in December
review: Traveller must visit this point and from November to March is ideally time and can see himalayas and other peaks of Naina devi and to enjoy this place. one can have good thrills and fresh oxygen

title: The Great Himalayan View
review: One can Get a great View of the Himalayas covered full of Snow.Amazing View.Reching there by a cable car is the best option.

title: Must visit !
review: Nice view of snow hills from this point. You can enjoy more if you use binoculars to see all snow mountains & other interesting point.

title: Amazing view of Himalayas
review: If sky is clear, it is suggested to go Snow View through rope way (you have to wait as there is always crowd for it). otherwise you can go by walk also. You can veiw magnificent view of Himalayas from here provided sky is clear.

title: Panaromic view of Himalayas.
review: If you want to enjoys the beauty of snow clad mountains this is the place. Looks so close that you can touch. Cable car is also available to reach this point. However in season the place is too crowded.

title: Mindblowing view of Snow clad Himalayan Peaks!
review: The place witness some awesome scenic views, and yes, we were lucky that we got to see the snow capped himalayan mountain peaks (no clouds)... & it was mind blowing!! Though we had to wait long for cable cars, but the place was worth our time.

title: worth the hike up
review: after a steep climb up the hill we were amazed at how beautiful the view was. Be prepared to not see much on a cloudy day however even so the view is still beautiful. The little stall on the left next to the view point has great coffee !

title: An ok place.
review: Hiked all the way up, but you can also take the ropeway. The views were not so great as it was very foggy when we went there.

title: Not Much to see, only Timepass
review: NO point going if the weather is cloudy or there is mist in the clouds

title: Good view but nothing great
review: This attraction is worth-visiting but ensure you check the weather forecast. if there is not ample sun-light or clarity, the view would be as good as nothing. In case you are seeking solitude, the place is good as tourist visit and leave, not much commotion!

title: Not an interesting place
review: You can visit this place but you can see other places instead of wasting your time there as the view is not clear.

title: Nice to take pics!
review: Not very fascinating but a nice point to take pics! Some telescopes are installed there but they seem to be worthless. Nothing much ..just for some pics

title: Great view Point
review: Away from city. but it is must see place. Have a good views of the Himalayas range.  Cool and calm feeling

title: Great place when snowy..
review: Its a great place when it has snowed a little.. you can have great breathtaking view of the entire valley. There are several shop so you can sit, relax and enjoy the view and the snow. Throw snow balls at each other for a change.. :)

title: Awesome View of Himalyas.. Must visit
review: A great view of Himalayan range. Cool and calm place.. u can enjoy snacks and tea also.. Horse Riding and other fun things are also present

title: In summers no point visiting it
review: In summers and especially when there is lot of dust around hence snow cannot be seen.  There is nothing special about this place esp during summer time

title: great view
review: This is the highest peak of Nainital.

title: Cable car experience is good
review: Visit after 10 AM and should check that sky is clear or not in advance. Game zone is not maintained.

title: No snow in summer
review: U should carry snow with u

title: Snow view or No view
review: It was bit hazy during the day due to which snow peaks were not visible. So we had maggie and tea there and came back.

title: Cable car ride is excellent, if lucky can view snow capped mountains
review: Snow view point can be reached by cable car or by cab. I would recommend an early morning cab ride to view the snow peaks. Also an evening ride to cable car to the top and view of lake and Nainital city is simply awesome.

title: "Beautiful"
review: On a clear day it is so beautiful to see the Snow covered mountains, but if its cloudy then no guarantee.

title: Nothing much to do
review: There nothing much you can do over here.You will only end up spending money on the cable car ride.If youre lucky, you might be able to see some Himalayan ranges. Not worth taking a chance. Waste of time and money.

title: Hill view
review: It's from here u could..see the Himalayas peek...but unfortunately we were here on a cloudy day so couldn't catch a glimpse of the majestic mountains

title: Not worth a visit on Summer Day
review: Long wait for cable car to go up in peak of summer holiday season with only to get view of lake is not worth it. Only good when you have clear sky when you can get nice view of snow capped Himalayan Peaks

title: Natural
review: Would definitely like to recommend all the visitors to visit this place who are interested in natural views

title: an eye wash
review: though the name sounds exotic, the place is over commercialise. u hardly get to see the distant himalayan peaks..forget snow covered ones. the cable car ride is OKKAy.....if one wants to go there just to add an attraction to the itinerary..then fine..otherwise u may let go this one.

title: No Snow
review: It is claimed that you can see snow clad mountains from here but i guess pollution and bad weather excuses will always be there. Nothing great.

title: visible during sep that too if the sky is clear
review: Himalay view- to reach this place you will have to climb around sloop (which is of concert) Then again Himalayas are visible only during Sep. So we were told. That too if the sky is clear.

title: Wow...
review: Amazing view, we took the horse ride to reach the view point. The way to reach the snow view point was amazing and once you reach the point, the view was mesmerizing.

title: Not worth a visit
review: Very disappointed since you will see nothing. The man handling the telescope was very clear that people are fooled and may be in Nov or Dec or jan one may enjoy but certainly not from April to September.

title: No view in summers
review: In summers snow is not visible from this point due to fire in jungle and fog, so the snow is visible in after rainy season or in winters, if busy can avoid this place too.

title: Very Average
review: Cable car ride is ok if you are doing it for the first time.Nothing much to do once you reach paek except overprices rides for kids.You won't miss a lot if you don't go there.

title: Good for young kids
review: We went in April 3rd week and there was no snow to view.  The trip to the snow view point can be by the cable car.  At Rs 150 per adult for a 3 mts trip this cable car is not attractive and can be avoided.  There are only two cars, no sitting space, about 6-8 people stand in the car.  In the absence of clear windows photography was also difficult.

title: nice view
review: view is awesome like painting

title: SNOW VIEW
review: Snow view point is ( 2270 Mts) About 3 kms from the town and also accessible via Cable Car/ Rope Way. Snow view is one of the most visited tourist spots of the town. It provides enchanting view of the town and 350 km long range of the Glittering Mighty Himalayas.

title: Brilliant view
review: the ride to the top was on a horse back...

title: spare an hour
review: on a no cloudy day one can take the rope way and go there to see the himalayan range from a distance

title: Visit this place in clear weather
review: Make sure that you visit this place in clear weather or else you will not get any view of snow capped Himalayas :-)

title: Picture perfect point!!
review: To get the perfect view, luck should be with us.. No Clouds n u can get the view!! U can click nice photos here.. n can enjoy tea n Maggie!!

title: worth visiting...if its not cloudy
review: Snow view pt is a place from where u can see the Himalayan valley if its a clear sky. U can reach here by taxi or ropeway. U can spend an hour here and enjy maggi and tea at this peak along with other snacks.

title: No snow, No view...
review: Undoubtedly, its second best attraction of Nainital after Naini lake. Rope way (cost. Rs 150/- adults and Rs 100/- for kids) connects Mall road to Snow view point. Tourists get one hour for the return ride back to Mall road. If tourists delay their return, they have to pay again for the return ride. The ropeway ride starts around 9am, but by then, view of Himalayas gets misty and blurred and one has to see them through powerful telescope which is charged at Rs 10/- per minute. though Rs 10/- isn't much, still, I didn't find any worth in spending money for a blurry vision. Couldn't see the Mighty Himalayas... :(

title: nature
review: Only seen when no clouds through telescope More chances of clouds and snow peaks may not be seen. You may visit by ropeways

title: Try this place,lucky if a clear weather
review: It is around 14 kms from mall road but viw is fantastic,they have a horse, maggi sellers, binacoulars and fancy dress wala, enjoy the scene with family

title: Nice place
review: You can reach here by two ways : Rope way or road. For Rope way, you need advance booking. If you book Rope Way in morning, your turn would come in evening. We took a bike on rent and reached by road. There is an adventure park at Snow View Point, so it's a good place to spend time.

title: Excellent place
review: Snowview point is accessible through a ropeway which starts near Mall Road. There is also a road leading to the top but the ropeway is more fun. You can spend an hour at the top. There is a good view of the snow covered Himalayan peaks from the back side whereas the front side gives a view of Nainital.

title: Spectacular views
review: From here you can see amazing views of the Himalayas. Best to go early in the morning as the mists rise from the valley floor by about ten or eleven o'clock. It will also be quieter, though the pay-to-use binoculars will not be there so bring your own if you have them.

title: Must visit
review: If you love the mountains a must visit. One can see all the important peaks like nanda Devi, trishul, kedar badri, panchachula ..... Do try the telescope view for 20 bucks each. A great place to capture some amazing shots.

title: good excursion
review: one of the lead attractions at nainital..

title: Snow clad Himalayan view + lot of children activities
review: Easily accessible through ropeway (10 am to 4 pm, Ticket Rs 150/-) and motor able road, though preferred former giving breath taking view of city which starts at Mallital, close to Mall road. Lot of play activities for children start of cable car and at top. Ate Maggi and fresh pakoras in the sun soaked cold noon which rejuvenated our energy!!!

title: As for cloudy weather nothing is viewed...
review: We visited there in roapway. Roapway ride is really nice.. and the place is also nice.............................

title: Nice place to spend a morning
review: You will find cars available in Mall Road parking lot offering Package to couple of view points at 1000 bucks.

title: Good to go in clear weather
review: It's your chance to enjoy ropeway or cable car ride in Nainital if you are with kids. You can view the snow peak of Himalayas from this view point. At a distance of 2.5 kms from the town and worth a visit in clear weather. If you are alone then take those Maruti 800 local taxi to have a adrenaline rush of driving to the peak at very stiff gradient.

title: One of the best tourist spot in nainital
review: i went nainital in month of march,2014. i reached snow view point with trolly, which start from mallital. I saw the best view of Himalaya Darshan. Many sporting games  are also there. If anyone visit  nainital he/she must go to snow view point with trolly. Don't miss this.

title: good spot
review: Trolleys ply upto  snow view but i make it a point to track which is quite enjoyable.There are houses on the way and even upto the top.no snow  peaks  were visible  in july.But from october onwards the  view of  snow clad peaks from  here is fantastic.there are eating joints serving tea and snacks.most people  now  go by trolley which involves huge wait or advance booking especially in summers.

title: amazing
review: We went this place on a rainy day and we could not see snow because of season and clouds.However view is breath taking and a must visit

title: Nice point to see
review: We went there by the ropeway which is available near the naini lake. The view is nice though we could not see the himalayas due to clouds. Ropeway experience is excellent

title: On a clear day ...
review: A great place on a clear day. We saw the High Himalyas in the distance and I took a look through the binoculars for a fee of 10INR ... Well worth it. It is nice to roam around the wooded hilltop where there is also a pleasure garden with rides for young people and also some shops. The ropeway ride up the hill is short but also fun.

title: Wow
review: Its's simply a wow place, we viewed clouds and snow covered peaks...awesome view....loved the place...its' worth the wait for the trolley and walk...beautiful

title: Must visit place
review: The snow-capped Himalayan range is the main attraction of Snow View Point. On a clear day you can see Trishool Peak, Nainadevi Peak and lots more. These Peaks are big enough to see with good eye sight however there are binoculars available on the top which can help you to see the close view of these peaks and it’s worth a try. You can reach Snow View point via rope way and Rs.150/Adult will be the charge for the both ways. You can do go Carting and Shooting over there.

title: Good short tourist visiting spot.
review: You need to use ropeway to reach to this spot which itself is exciting. The spot is very good and specially if you use the binoculars you can easily spot the Himalaya peaks.

title: Nice View
review: This view has almost identical view to certain other points, but still worth the visit as there is a pair of binoculars installed through which you can clearly see the mountains on a clear day.

title: Excellent Point
review: You need to have vehicle to access this point, alternatively you can walk as well but that would be steep height. If the weather is clear then only it is recommendable to go there.

title: good place
review: it one of the top point in nainital. on the snow point you can see the snow on the far away hills covered by the snow.

title: the not so good snow
review: It is called snow view point but with not much snow there.It is good for couples but slightly dirty and unclean.

title: Top of the hill
review: A binoculars(charged) has been installed there to view snow capped mountains peak and on bright sunny days many himalayan peaks are visible from this point.

title: Not in summer...
review: The point from where you can have a glimpse of Himlaya with snow covered..but it is rarely visible from March to October..as there is mist..can take chance...

title: view is good
review: wish this point was less commercialised n chaotic. too many shops and people spoil the tranquility of nature around.

title: Nothing Much
review: Its just okay, You can view snow covered peaks on a clear day, has got some eating joints and is ok if you are looking for a gondola ride.

title: bad
review: not good for us. if anybody visited manali, kashmir, they will never like that. very bad. we really do not like this

title: it is a waste of time
review: you don't have binaculors to view the sonw peaks.

title: Beautiful view of the lake and wilderness from snow view
review: Enjoyed going via cable car to snow view. In peak season better to get your tickets 1 day before. Booking starts from 12 PM onwards. Very quiet and peaceful once you reach snow view point. However, cannot see the Himalayas like in the past 25 years ago. For that go to Naina Peak.

title: Nice views of the like from a height
review: There are just a couple of views. We had gone in May and it was cloudy. So couldn't see any mountain views. There are a couple of spots for the views. There is also a children's play area.We went up in the ropeway and it was a nice 10 min ride. But you have to wait there for atleast 45 mins for your turn to come back.

title: Avoid on a small trip
review: walking and reaching the peak gives enormous satisfaction. Don't expect surprises at peak. just enjoy your journey whilst reaching the peak.

title: Great view from the rope-way
review: The rope-way ride is a delight. It gives a bird's eye view of Nainital. The view of Himalayas is great, too.

title: This is awesome
review: People must see it. If you are driving through your car, it is not recommended to drive yourself until you are excellent in hill driving.

title: Cable car ride to enjoy
review: This place is just an average with a nice view. But the good part is the cable car ride starting from Mall Road till this point with 1 hour stay for return trip. My kids loved the ride. One can enjoy the snacks there or just have hills view from different points. There are some fun activities (kids rides/balloon shooting) at the lower point of cable junction. Worth a visit if accompanying kids.

title: amazing place
review: it was an amazing place to njoy the scenic beauty from the ropeway and people can njoy various activities there. Must visit.

title: Nice Place
review: We went by rope way. It's a nice experience. There is KMVN Hotel at the top also (Check in / out time 1200 hrs). The charges are inclusive of Dinner and Breakfast. Free Fall Tower is an added attraction.

title: lovely view of himalayas
review: They really look so lovely from the point , although sometimes might not be visible because of clouds and bad weather ... so choose a sunny and clear day to visit those

title: Nice view & Time pass options
review: - You can reach Snow View point by ropeway or car. Through ropeway you will get an amazing view of the Naini Lake & Nainital. Don't drive the car to this point if you are NOT well versed with driving in hills.

title: Business over Beauty
review: The place when I last visited, many years ago was extremely beautiful and picturesque and at that time there was no ropeway but now it is choc-o-block with so much of commercial activity like tea shops, dhabas, a miniature Appu Ghar etc. that it has lost its charm of being a very quite, pleasant and scenic spot. But on a clear day, still worth the visit.

title: snow view point
review: snow view point is very best place and rope rider trolly is also good. Himalaya view point is very good.

title: See Himalaya peaks
review: You can reach snow view point thru cable car ! and you can see the snow clad ranges of Himalaya peaks further you can also have recreational facilities specially for children as there is game zone + food zone !

title: Himalayan range overlook
review: This is the point from where u can see the himalyan range. You have to go there through just 10min. of rope-way travelling. If whether is clear than you can see himalyan range with naked eye or with help of telescope, otherwise enjoy the ride of ropeway.

title: Must try - Gravity Fall
review: want an adrenalin rush at 7000 ft - try out the Gravity fall ride. Its out of the world. For the top you get the cold breezing in, with beautiful view of the snow capped himalayas...go experience it!

title: Very good view point
review: Its a very good view point for watching the entire Himalayan range. Something which you can see from Ranikhet and Kausani can be seen here itself. Though its a point on a road with minimal facilities. There are small food stalls and photographers / telescope facilities.

title: Great view
review: The look at the white himalayas from this point is really breathtaking. There are loads of activities available at this location. My personal favourite was the shooting(gun). Great place for pics and selfies.

title: Loads of Snow
review: There was loads of snow to paly with in the second week of January and we spent the maximum time there. It has amazing view of the himalayas with all the other facilities

title: Just snow view..
review: Snow View is situated at an altitude of 2,270 m (7,450 ft) and located atop the Sher-ka-danda Ridge (north by north-east of the town centre), is easily reachable by cable car.Charges for cable car is Rs. 150 per person, Rs. 75 for child. Charges are for stay for one hour at the point. Timings are 10.00 am to 5.00 pm on a clear day, it offers spectacular views of the snowbound high Himalaya, including Nanda Devi, Trisul, and Nanda Kot. The best time of the year for viewing the mountains is late October and November.

title: Must visit place
review: Visit this place by Ropeway which is situated next to Khotia Market. They charge 150/person and allow only 1 hour on hill top. We were lucky to enjoy snow there. Snow was every where and view also nice like lake view and snow view

title: Average
review: The best part is the Cable car ride to the top. You see Himalayas far away if the sky is clear. There is a Binoculars for a closer view, but nothing great.

title: Problematic
review: This is a good idea with a cable car ride to the top but the area there is not very inviting. The view areas are badly organised with shooting galleries (air rifle) spread around. The look out points have a paradox that the trees obscure the view, but how can you cut the trees.

title: Snow View Point - Nainital
review: This peak is approachable by road as well as rope-way trolley which itself gives a good experience by overseeing Nainital. During clear days, u can see Himalayan Peak covered with Snow. Further a thrilling experience u can have on Free Fall, set up there at the top. Really a must have experience.

title: Full of snow
review: We were lucky to in Nainital in a day when there was a snowfall. We were among the first fel people to get into the cable car and reach the snow view point on that day. The place was full of snow and fog. We were not able to take a view of the sorroundings due to the fog but enjoyed planing in snow for some time.A must visit place in Nainital.

title: no snow veiw
review: I find snow veiw point is just waste of money. Due to clouds, you do not see any snow. Just you get the experience of rope ride. Just rope ride is not worth of paying so much of money

title: View of snow in certain part of year only...
review: We went there by taxi though one can go by ropeway also. The rope way  costs around 150 per person while taxi (alto) costs 600 for 7 points like snow view point, lovers point, naini lake point, khurpa tal point etc.

title: Breathtaking....
review: Breathtaking....Seen the himalayan range, the OM parvat. I have never seen the same this close, this beautiful. Nature at its best.

title: FANTASTIC
review: To get to this point one should go via ropeway and will get to see the aerial view of Naintial town and the lake. The best part is when the clouds come on your face while you are goin up or coming down via cable car. The points and rides at this point are also very good specially Rappeling and a Free Fall Ride. One gets a majestic view of 300 kms long range of Himalayas covered with snow only if the weather is clear. A fantastic point to click some good pics and have really good fun. Though the only turn off is the lack of proper restaurants and the quality of food served here but that can be ignored after what you get to see at this point. Simply Majestic

title: Not so exiting
review: There was a hype of snow view point among the guides in nainital, but there was nothing exiting about it. Yes there was a long range of mountains which can be viewed from a landmark place. OK to take pictures. There is a small temple next to the point. Can go, but not a must visit.

title: good
review: Snow view point is a hill top from where you can get a good view of the snow capped mountains. There are a large number of vendors who take a small fee and lend there telescope to see the snow clad mountains. Also there is a small rope ride to this point is also good and very safe as it is closed from all sides. You will also find many shops up there from where you can buy gifts or woolens.

title: great place !!!
review: If the weather is clear and non cloudy you can actually see almost all high peaks of nanda devi from this point..

title: Beautiful view of Snow clad Himalayan Mountain range !
review: There is a 700 meter rope way ride from Nainital town to the Snow view point. The view of the snow covered Himalayan mountain range is breath taking. Also, the view of Nainital lake from the ropeway is awesome. Must visit if you are in Nainital.

title: Nice view but that is it.
review: Nice view but that is it. Nothing else in that place was very welcoming. The bath rooms were stinking and the only bar on the hilltop is next to the men's bathroom.

title: Fun to go up there through cable car
review: Its just a routine point. IN summer the clouds are there and ofcourse there is no snow view... If its clear, you can see the peaks.

title: View Point
review: It was sumer and sky was not clear so we could not see snow peaks..One can go by cable car ride to see snow view

title: A fun activity..... if you are in Nainital !!
review: First and foremost, if you are going there during the season, tickets for the cable car need to be booked at least one day in advance.

title: Fun ..but too much hype
review: It's one of the high tourist point of Nainital..as you can see Himalayas..from the peek..but well..it depends on whether you have a clear view on that day or not.

title: Overrated
review: Firstly, you can reach snow point by car also and I think that would be better. The ropeway is hardly 5 minutes and just climbs vertically instead of moving horizontally. So it is more like a lift than a ropeway. The views are ok. On the top there are few shops and rides for kids. But everything is cramped together and overdone. It is ok but not out of the world so dont go expecting the moon!

title: very costly
review: swings and food were very costly but views were good.......we went by trolley.....it took us about 4 to 5 min.... to reach... but had fun .it was a nice expirence overall............

title: Himalayan Ranges View
review: There's nothing wow like visiting at snow view point and spending 160 bucks(through ropeway) or 700 bucks (hired car) as much more scenaric view of himalayan mountain can be seen by visiting Mukteshwar.But if you dont have sufficient time to visit Mukhteshwar than better to visit ths point.

title: Snow view point
review: I could not see the snow since it was in May but photos do show Himalayas in glory for a great view .Worthwhile to visit in December or January

title: A must visit!!
review: Just awesome..we were very lucky as it was a clear day and the whole range of Himalayan peaks were visible. You can have photo sessions with your family also. Family with children, just bit careful because there are no wall-guards out there!!

title: Not as awesome as touted.
review: The panoramic view is shrouded with clouds and fog ..specially in the winter months when we visited.  The peak tops merged with the cloud cover making it hardly distinguishable ,

title: View Himalayan Peaks...
review: Through the ropeway you can reach the Snow View Point from Mall Road...From there you can view the Snow capped Himalayan Peaks...

title: Panormic View of snow caped Mountains
review: Snow view point is 3 Kms by car root.One can reach there on foot .We took a cable car ride from the cable car station and reached atop within less than ten minutes.View of the sno caped mountains in front was breath-taking. There was person with mounted telescope .showing the peaks and explaing about them.Charge was only Rs.5/-There is also a small Children park on the Rt side.We took multiple snaps of peaks before us and returned by the same cable car.It was wonderful sight .A panoramic view of Nainital and lake was real feast to the eyes.

title: great view of the Himalaya
review: Went there very early and got a very atmospheric view with mist in the valleys. Added bonus the hawkers hadn't turned up. when we came back later still a great view, but lots of hawkers.

title: One of Snow View Point
review: I accessed this point through cable car ride ..On arrival at top i could see beautiful view of  Lake. This cable car ride takes only 10-15 minutes it very small cable car ride.

title: Amazing
review: Amazing place. I didnot know mountain watching can be so beautiful. I have never felt snow but the cold wind of the hill top along with the view of the himalayan range was just amazing. Should try going there...

title: Overhyped
review: We went there in December.

title: Overrated
review: You will have more fun going up there, rather than being there..

title: Disappointment it was
review: Hmmm... the hills and the useless points go hand in hand seriously. The weather of Nainital was fine but when we reached the top after spending big money and time, we found the place with very little visibility and snow was nowhere to be seen, though the point is a famous one... probably we were the non blessed ones.

title: Children's corner
review: If you want your kids to have fun - there is the racing track (electric car) for kids and a small racing track for the teenagers... a small pool with boats for 3-8 year olds, a jumper for the still older ones... and toy train rides too... Can keep a kid engaged for almost a couple of hours.

title: Place is over rated
review: The place is over rated, nothing much to do up there after ropeb way ride. Also there is lot of garbage piled up there, they need to take care of cleanliness at such a scenic place.

title: Not so great
review: It is an ok place. Not so great. It is called Snow View Point but view is ordinary. It is a bit hyped up place.

title: Good view
review: As the name suggests you can view the snow covered peaks of himalayas provided the weather is clear and clouds are not obstructing the view. Other than that, there is not much, suggest to take the ropeway than to climb all the way on foot.

title: view
review: view of this peak from high hills and nice to see the himalaya. You will be proud that we are a indian. Only thing is tobe patient if whether is bad....

title: Nothing Special
review: The ropeway is one of the major attractions of Nainital and that is the reason why we went up to the Snow View Point via the rope way.

title: view point but no view
review: go only if its clear day without no clouds else you wont see any snow and it means no view. it was much better when I went there 10 years ago but this time it was not worth going there . cable car is an attraction to go there. one must try option if going there .

title: Sheer waste of money
review: Maybe i went in the wrong season,but there is absolutely nothing on the point barring a few shops and some games.The cable ride with burn your pocket by Rs.150/- per person. In case you want to take the ride be at the booking office early to avoid the rush else they give you a timeslot as per availability. You can also hike to Snow view point

title: Excellent
review: Excellent view point but the approach road is very very bad. There was no other way we can travel except horse. The road is very bad. The view point to see the snow mountains was very good.

title: Gud
review: snow view point is good if you in jan to may u couls see snow capped mountain from himalyas range

title: Snow View good to see
review: Snow View Point is a Good place for the people who have not seen snow, good to be there play with friends with snow and enjoy on it, take snaps but be sure about the shoes, wear sport shoes only and its too slipery so take care

title: I think it was a bit of an anti climax to be honest!
review: Unfortunately we did  not realise that during the month of April you are almost certainly not going to see the amazing snow capped mountains of the Himalayas from Snow View! Too hazy. Snow View became No View!! We walked to the top from the town, a pleasant and invigorating hike with plenty of refreshment stalls a long the way. We got a great view of Naini Lake below albeit through the haze. Snow View, a flat area at the top of the hill (and where the cable car stops) is a strange place...tacky to put it bluntly. The natural ambience and beauty has been somewhat ruined by tatty stalls, funfair rides and litter. (We did get some excellent lunch up there, I hasten to add!).Our senses met with some conflict...love it or hate it?!, This was just typical of such places in India and strangely we loved it!

title: just nice to break the day or with children
review: 3 minute ride to snow vieuw mountain. Lots of tourists in summertime. Beter in off season period. Take a walk from snow vieuw to the next hill. Talk a walk down the hill instead of the cablecar. For children its fun

title: Crowded!
review: Commercialised and crowded. Though one can enjoy a panoramic view of the town and, on clear days, snow capped Himalayan range.

title: ropeway expensive but worth it
review: 150Rs per adult and 100 Rs per child round trip is expensive for a 10 minute ride up the ropeway. Book tickets earlier in the day as your turn may come after a few hours. You can arrive at the time given and take the ride up.

title: Not worth the money
review: The cable car ride to snow view point is too expensive for the 6mts ride.  When you reach there, you will find only shops and nothing else.  The snow view point does not give you any view of the himalayan ranges and is hazy in the summer.  You can easily give this a miss, if you are short of time and have experienced a cable car ride before.

title: Good place for viewing himalayas
review: The best way to reach this place is go by rope way and it will cost Rs150 for adult and Rs 100 for child. They allow to stay at snow view point for an hour. The place is quite good, a hotel is also present. There are many eateries, gift shops and many adventure activities at this place. There is a huge binocular to see the Himalayas, Tiffin top and the China peak at cost of Rs 5 per head.

title: Very crowded and commercialized
review: If you are not visiting on clear days (either winter or just after a rain) there is hardly any views from Snow View point - certainly no trace of snow.

title: Nice view local feel
review: Snow view point in Nainital is a must visit for the breathtaking views of the Himalayas. The cable car which takes you up from mall road is well managed. At the snow point, there are several stalls for foods from all over India and the experience of eating noodles/dosa/masala tea/poori aloo/pizza/samosa all from same stall is a rare multi cuisine delight. Be sure to select a clear day for visiting this attraction to get good views. You can safely get photographed here with himalaya as the backdrop by the local photographer and be sure the pictures will reach you by courier.

title: Too much construction and amusement park-like atmosphere.
review: The snow view point is now spoilt by too much construction of shops and rides and karting circuits and what-not. You will have trouble finding the snow-view point itself. But the ride where they drop you free-fall is good as you can soak in the nearby whole Himalayan range while at the top of the ride.

title: Dissapointing
review: The cable car ride was fun with nice views.At the top however there was a village of huts,  garbage etc from the best vantage point to see the mountains.
